intro: Schickendantziella trichosepala, commonly known as the hairy-sepaled schickendantziella, is a unique member of the Schickendantzielleae tribe within the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, hairy sepals that give it its specific epithet. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and clustered in composite heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
